availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: A. B. Long (Hart County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Hart County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Lucy F. Williams Long. Father of Edward Long, Samuel Long, and Charles Long. Farmer in Warren County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned seventeen enslaved persons in Warren County in 1850. Farmer in Hart County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 59A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 2.

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, Rowletts Station, 8th Precinct, p. 407A.
